item.title: About
item.description: I am a second year PLME (Program in Liberal Medical Education) student at Brown concentrating in Computational Biology (Sc.B.) and History (A.B.). I am super interested in doing translational research with a focus on neuropsychiatric disorders. I am also passionate about public policy and and aim to make a difference. At the Larschan and O’Connor Giles Labs, I research gene regulation of synaptogensis in fly larvae. I work closely under the direction of my mentor, James Kentro, a doctoral candidate.

item.title: Projects

Melanogaster Synaptic Gene Motifs in Embryonic Neurons between 10-12 hours (Poster) Leadership PLME Senate Treasurer Brown Outing Club Treasurer University Resources Committee Brown Outdoor Leadership Training Leader
